sentences.english: They've built a wall of players for a penalty shot.
sentences.chinese: 他们筑起一堵人墙准备对付罚点球射门。

sentences.english: Armed police have barricaded people again, stepping forward forcing them back.
sentences.chinese: 武警再筑人墙，双方步步紧逼。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper organizing to build up a wall.
sentences.chinese: 守门员正在组织筑人墙。

sentences.english: Other people clustered around them forming a human wall .
sentences.chinese: 其他人簇拥在他们的周围，形成一道人墙。

sentences.english: They were still forming a human barricade when I visited on June 23.
sentences.chinese: 在6月23日我去的时候，那里仍然继续着人墙阻挡。

sentences.english: Typical is a six- or seven-man wall.
sentences.chinese: 通常搭人墙都是六七个人。

sentences.english: Gerrard's second goal was a free-kick which slid past Darren Fletcher in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德第二个进球是擦着弗莱彻的身边绕过人墙的。

definition: to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
to get out of the way
ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
